newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian money rate down 20 bps, liquidity good.
newsitem.headline: Croatian money rate down 20 bps, liquidity good.

text.p: The Croatian average lending rate lost 20 basis points to 12.8 percent on Wednesday in modest trade and amid continued good liquidity, dealers said.
They put total daily trade at 15.4 million kuna, against 140 million kuna the banks, all of which had positive accounts, were offering.
Fresh deals accounted for 9.9 million kuna. Five million kuna were 60-day loans struck at 16 percent, down from Tuesday's 18.
The weighted call money rate went down to 7.7 percent, although banks extended old call money deals at the usual eight percent.
The banks rolled over previous term loans at 12 percent for two-week and 13, 15 and 22 percent for one-month deals.
The central bank calculated its kuna midrates for Thursday weaker at 6.5352 against the dollar and at 3.5708 against the German mark. -- Zoran Radosavljevic, Zagreb Newsroom +385 1 455 7075
